org.efaps.util.cache

Class AbstractCache<T extends CacheObjectInterface>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.util.cache.AbstractCache<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - class implementing CacheObjectInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAutomaticCache

    public abstract class AbstractCache<T extends CacheObjectInterface>
extends Object

    The class is used to cache three not independent information which are completely defined once but needed many times within eFaps. An example is to load all types at startup and access the cached data instead of reading the cached information each time they are needed.

    If a reload of the cache is needed, the cached object could be accessed, but returns the "old" values until the old cache is replaced by the new read values.

    The class is thread save, but a cached instance could be accessed much faster than a synchronized hash map.

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      • get

        public T get(long _id)
        Returns for given key id the cached object from the cache4Id cache. If the cache was not initialized yet, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        _id - id of the searched cached object
        Returns:
        cached object
        See Also:
        getCache4Id()

      • addObject

        public void addObject(T _object)
        Add an object to this Cache. This method should only be used to add some objects, due to the reason that it is very slow!!! Normally the values should be added by using abstract method readCache(Map, Map, Map).
        Parameters:
        _object - Object to be added

      • hasEntries

        public boolean hasEntries()
        The method tests, if the cache has stored some entries.
        Returns:
        true if the cache has some entries, otherwise false

        _newCache4Name - cache for name
        _newCache4UUID - cache for UUID
